Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw one land habitat, such as a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot.
The student can draw one water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can illustrate different types of plants found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can illustrate different types of animals found in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can show differences between the types of living things found in the two habitats.
The student can identify patterns of plant and animal diversity in the drawn habitats.
